means: 给…装衬垫，加垫子( pad的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The old man was padding along.
sentence.Network_cn: 这位老人慢慢地向前走去.

sentence.Network_en: The shoe has padding around the collar, heel and tongue for added comfort.
sentence.Network_cn: 鞋子的鞋帮、鞋跟和鞋舌部位都有衬垫，以增加舒适度。

sentence.Network_en: Of the sonnet eleven of the lines are mere padding and say nothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 那首十四行诗中有11行都是废话，毫无意义。

encyclopedia.content: 简介 检索或设置对象四边的补丁边距。 语法：padding :padding-top | padding-right | padding-bottom | padding-left 说明：检索或设置对象四边的内补丁。对于td和th对象而言默认值为1。其他对象的默认值为0。 参数：length :长度值、% : 百分比，由父元素宽度决定 。 初始值：对于 td 和 th 对象而言默认值为 1 。其他对象的默认值为 0 。 继承性：不可继承 注释：不允许使用负值。 如果提供全部四个参数值，将按上－右－下－左

entry.def: Padding is soft material which is put on something or inside it in order to make it less hard, to protect it, or to give it a different shape.

example.ex: ...the foam rubber padding on the headphones...
example.tran: 头戴式耳机上的泡沫橡胶垫料

example.ex: Players must wear padding to protect them from injury.
example.tran: 运动员必须戴防护垫以免受伤。

entry.tran: 冗词赘句；凑篇幅的废话
entry.def: Padding is unnecessary words or information used to make a piece of writing or a speech longer.

example.ex: Of the sonnet eleven of the lines are mere padding and say nothing.
example.tran: 那首十四行诗中有11行都是废话，毫无意义。

example.ex: ...the kind of subject that politicians put in their speeches for a bit of padding.
example.tran: 政客在演讲中凑篇幅的那类话题

means.word_mean: 1. artifact consisting of soft or resilient material used to fill or give shape or protect or add comfort

auth_sentence.content: Protective padding of bony prominences should be also used.

auth_sentence.content: Indeed, it comes across as mere padding.
auth_sentence.res_content: Indeed, it comes across as mere padding.
